definition: to judge between right and wrong/to reason things out
to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: Save the debates for when you're with friends whose opinions matter to you.
sentences.chinese: 想評理的話，找朋友說去吧，他們的意見才重要。

sentences.english: Those close to your heart may be difficult to reason with.
sentences.chinese: 很難與那些心靈相惜的人評理。

sentences.english: To find the commissar reason, LiBiao WangZhengWei just let him keep sufficient flesh.
sentences.chinese: 不甘心的李彪找政委評理，王政委只是讓他養足肉體。

sentences.english: Children find they judge to go, want to drag his son to go with strong meter.
sentences.chinese: 兒找他們評理去，還想拖着兒子米強一塊兒去。

definition: lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
Please do as you wish!/You are welcome to do whatever you like!/Please make yourself at home.
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
to have a fist fight/fist fight/brawl
to whisper to one another's ear
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
